content.raw:
I've found a possible bug that occurs when I'm importing mpl_toolkits.axes_grid1:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
AttributeError: 'DoubleImportDenier' object has no attribute 'find_spec'

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\labscript_suite\lyse\analysis_subprocess.py", line 309, in do_analysis
    exec(code, sandbox)
  File "MakeImageStacks.py", line 11, in <module>
    from analysislib.subroutines.imageStackViewer import IndexTracker
  File "C:\labscript_suite\userlib\analysislib\subroutines\imageStackViewer.py", line 14, in <module>
    import mpl_toolkits.axes_grid1
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 968, in _find_and_load
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 953, in _find_and_load_unlocked
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 892, in _find_spec
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 873, in _find_spec_legacy
  File "C:\labscript_suite\labscript_utils\double_import_denier.py", line 77, in find_module
    fp, pathname, description = imp.find_module(name, path)
  File "C:\Users\cavslab\AppData\Local\Continuum\anaconda3\lib\imp.py", line 271, in find_module
    "not {}".format(type(path)))
RuntimeError: 'path' must be None or a list, not <class '_frozen_importlib_external._NamespacePath'>

```

By removing the import mpl_toolkits.axes_grid1, I can avoid the attribute error and throw a name error instead (later in the code). The error occurs when running Labscript in Python 3, but I don't know if that is important.
content.html:
I've found a possible bug that occurs when I'm importing mpl_toolkits.axes_grid1:

Traceback (most recent call last):
AttributeError: 'DoubleImportDenier' object has no attribute 'find_spec'

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\labscript_suite\lyse\analysis_subprocess.py", line 309, in do_analysis
    exec(code, sandbox)
  File "MakeImageStacks.py", line 11, in <module>
    from analysislib.subroutines.imageStackViewer import IndexTracker
  File "C:\labscript_suite\userlib\analysislib\subroutines\imageStackViewer.py", line 14, in <module>
    import mpl_toolkits.axes_grid1
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 968, in _find_and_load
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 953, in _find_and_load_unlocked
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 892, in _find_spec
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 873, in _find_spec_legacy
  File "C:\labscript_suite\labscript_utils\double_import_denier.py", line 77, in find_module
    fp, pathname, description = imp.find_module(name, path)
  File "C:\Users\cavslab\AppData\Local\Continuum\anaconda3\lib\imp.py", line 271, in find_module
    "not {}".format(type(path)))
RuntimeError: 'path' must be None or a list, not <class '_frozen_importlib_external._NamespacePath'>

By removing the import mpl_toolkits.axes_grid1, I can avoid the attribute error and throw a name error instead (later in the code). The error occurs when running Labscript in Python 3, but I don't know if that is important.

content.raw: Thanks for the report! This should be fixed by pull request #45.
content.html: Thanks for the report! This should be fixed by pull request #45.
